intro: Neltuma chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the arid and saline conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Neltuma chilensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
